page.title: 02Colden Common:Landscape 1.
page.content: There are three main landscape elements in the block: The well dissected dip-slope of the Chalk is at its highest in the north-east at about 90m.O.D.and slopes down to the south-west,reaching 35m.at the junction with the Tertiary rocks. These Lower Tertiary rocks are mainly clays and produce a broad vale draining west towards the R.Itchen valley.The lowest ground in the block is found on this western edge at 25m. In the extreme south-west the land rises to 60m.representing the scarp face produced by the Bagshot Beds of the Tertiary.
